meanings.definition: To cross in or into; to intersect
meanings.sent1: The roads were incrossing at the busy intersection.
meanings.sent2: I saw the two paths incrossing in the middle of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The incrossing of the two rivers created a beautiful natural pattern.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and emotions incrossed, causing inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes incrossed to form a mesmerizing painting.

meanings.definition: The act of crossing in or into; intersection
meanings.sent1: The incrossing of the two streets caused a traffic jam.
meanings.sent2: We observed the incrossing of the train tracks from a safe distance.
meanings.sent3: The incrossing of the paths in the park confused the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The incrossing of cultures in the city created a vibrant community.
meanings.sent5: The incrossing of timelines in the movie made for an intriguing plot twist.
